content.webTitle: Hamiltons arrested over allegations of sexual assault

fields.headline: Hamiltons arrested over allegations of sexual assault
fields.bodyText: The disgraced former Tory MP, Neil Hamilton, and his wife Christine have been arrested following an allegation of serious sexual assault, police sources said tonight. The couple attended Barkingside police station in East London by appointment this afternoon. They were then arrested and are currently being questioned by officers. The incident is alleged to have taken place on May 5 in London. Scotland Yard would not confirm the couple's identity, saying only that "a 52-year-old man and a 51-year-old woman attended a police station by appointment today. They were arrested in connection with an allegation of serious sexual assault." The incident follows the couple's declaration of bankruptcy in May after losing a lengthy libel battle to Mohammed Al Fayed, the millionaire owner of Harrods. He had accused Mr Hamilton of accepting cash for asking parliamentary questions during his time as an MP. Related articles 23.05.2001: Bankrupt Hamilton vows to fight on in European court 22.05.2001: Hamilton declared bankrupt 22.12.2000: Hamilton protests as he loses the last battle
